member.summary: Binds specified target HTML element with CSS rule and adds this CSS rule to the specified output stylesheet
member.param: Target HTML element, which should be bound. Cannot be NULL. Should be bounded to the parent HTML document.
Declaration block for the HTML element. May have content. May be NULL - in this case it will be created.
Output stylesheet, to which the newly created rule will be added. If NULL, then corresponding stylesheet of the input HTML document, to which belongs the target element, will be used.
member.returns: Declaration block for the HTML element, which was added to stylesheet inside the rule.

member.summary: Removes all CSS declarations from the declaration block, which are present and have equal values in the declaration block
member.param: Original declaration block, which is only read and is not modified.
Resultant declaration block, which is read and modified during execution: all CSS declarations, which are present in the , and have the same values, will be removed from it.
member.returns: Number of removed declarations

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Html.HtmlElementBase.UpdateAttributes(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Serialization.ISerializationOptions)
member.summary: Every implementing type should implement this method, which should gather all data from the HTML element and update corresponding attributes in attribute collection. In case of general serialization procedure (when it is not overridden by the inheritants) this method will be called just before performing the serialization. It allows to update/fullfill the attribute collection for the inheritant types, because serialization uses only attribute collection, it 'doesn't know' internals of each distinct HTML element.
member.param: Serialization options for attribute values, which may or may not be used by inheritant types

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetBodyContent
member.summary: Returns a body of the HTML document (content between opening and closing BODY tags without these tags) as a string.
member.remarks: WYSIWYG editors operate with the body of the document and cannot correctly process its meta information from the HEAD block. This method is designed for such cases.
member.returns: String, which contains the body of the HTML document

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetBodyContent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a body of the HTML document (content between opening and closing BODY tags without these tags) as a string, where links to the external resources contain specified prefix.
member.remarks: WYSIWYG editors operate with the body of the document and cannot correctly process its meta information from the HEAD block. This method is designed for such cases.
member.param: Through this parameter used can specify a prefix, which will be added to the links to all external resources (images, fonts, CSS), which will be present in the resultant HTML string. If NULL or empty, prefixes will not be added.
member.returns: String, which contains the body of the HTML document with links, adjusted to the external resources

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetContent
member.summary: Returns overall content of the HTML document as a string.

member.summary: Returns overall content of the HTML document as a string, where links to the external resources contain specified prefix.
member.param: Through this parameter used can specify a prefix, which will be added to the links to all external resources (images, fonts, CSS), which will be present in the resultant HTML string. If NULL or empty, prefixes will not be added.
member.returns: String, which contains the content of the HTML document with links, adjusted to the external resources

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetCssContent
member.summary: Returns content of the external CSS as a string or NULL, if there is no CSS for this document.
member.returns: CSS document content

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetCssContent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns content of the external CSS as a string, where links to the external resources contain specified prefix, or NULL, if there is no CSS for this document.
member.param: Through this parameter used can specify a prefix, which will be added to the links to all external resources (images and fonts), which will be present in the resultant CSS string. If NULL or empty, prefixes will not be added.
member.returns: CSS document content

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.InputHtmlDocument.GetEmbeddedHtml
member.summary: Returns all content of this HTML document with all related resources in a form of a single string, where all resources are embedded inside the HTML markup in a base64-encoded form.

member.summary: Pushes all declarations from specified declaration block into this declaration block. Boolean parameter determines how to process matches.
member.param: If true, all matches from specified block will replace declarations from this block. If false, an exception will occur on the first match. In other words, 'true' serves as 'Upsert', and 'false' - as 'Add' method for all declarations.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssOm
member.summary: CSS document, which is represented in a form of hierarchical Object Model with ability to manipulate its structure. Supports flexible and customizable serialization.
member.remarks: Each CSS document consists of a list of items, called CSS rules. All rules consist of two parts: textual identifier and declaration block. All rules are divided on two parts: at-rules and rule sets. Identifier for the at-rules is fixed and constant (unique identifier for each type of the at-rule) and is preceded by '@' character. Identifier for the rule sets is called a 'selector' and has its own internal structure and logics, which is encapsulated into a separate class 'CssSelector'. Declaration block for every rule is a set of declarations. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Introduction_to_CSS https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Syntax

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssOm.TryAdd(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.ICssRule)
member.summary: Adds specified rule to this CssOm, if it doesn't contain it, or do nothing, if this CssOm already contains the rule with such identifier
member.param: Rule (ruleset or at-rule), which should be added to this CssOm, if it still is not present here. May be NULL, in that case nothing will happen.
member.returns: True if specified rule was added; false, if it was not added because there is another (or the same) rule with identical identifier there, or specified rule is NULL

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssOm.ToResource(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Serialization.ISerializationOptions)
member.summary: Serializes this instance of the CSSOM to the text using specified options and returns it as a CSS resource

This implementation is not CSS-compliant: it doesn't support "background-origin", "background-clip", and "background-attachment". Some of supported long-hand properties are also not CSS-compliant. This property also doesn't support global values.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat
member.summary: Represents a "background-repeat" CSS declaration, which defines how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal axis, the vertical axis, both axes, or not repeated at all. Is a long-hand part of the "background" short-hand declaration.
member.remarks: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-repeat Warning! This implementation is not CSS3-compliant, it supports only single value for one background-image

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat._state
member.summary: xxssvvhh, where: xx - 2 bits, not used, should always be 00 ss - 2 bits, state: 0 - normal; 1 - inherit; 2 - initial; 3 - unset; vv - 2 bits, vertical component hh - 2 bits, horizontal component see also: http://stackoverflow.com/a/12691132
member.example: Default value: 00 00 00 00 (repeat repeat) Inherit value: 00 01 00 00 Initial value: 00 10 00 00 Unset value : 00 11 00 00 Space Round : 00 00 10 01 (10 - vertical component (Round); 01 - horizontal component (Space)) RepeatY : 00 00 00 11 (00 - vertical component (Repeat); 11 - horizontal component (NoRepeat))

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.op_Equality(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat)
member.summary: Checks whether two "BackgroundRepeat" values are equal

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.op_Inequality(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat)
member.summary: Checks whether two "BackgroundRepeat" values are not equal

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.Repeat
member.summary: The background image will be repeated both vertically and horizontally. Default value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatX
member.summary: The background image will be repeated only horizontally

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatY
member.summary: The background image will be repeated only vertically

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.NoRepeat
member.summary: The background-image will not be repeated

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatValue
member.summary: Represents the 'repeat' value in context of 'two-value syntax' for horizontal or vertical axis

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatValue.Repeat
member.summary: The image is repeated as much as needed to cover the whole background image painting area. The last image will be clipped if it doesn't fit.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatValue.Space
member.summary: The image is repeated as much as possible without clipping. The first and last images are pinned to either side of the element, and whitespace is distributed evenly between the images.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatValue.Round
member.summary: As the allowed space increases in size, the repeated images will stretch (leaving no gaps) until there is room for another one to be added.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundRepeat.RepeatValue.NoRepeat
member.summary: The image is not repeated (and hence the background image painting area will not necessarily be entirely covered).

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize
member.summary: Represents a "background-size" CSS declaration, which specifies the size of the background images. The size of the image can be fully constrained or only partially in order to preserve its intrinsic ratio. Is a long-hand part of the "background" short-hand declaration.
member.remarks:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds-3/#the-background-size
Warning! This implementation is not CSS3-compliant, it supports only single value for one background-size.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize._state
member.summary: Bit field xxxxwwhh, where: xxxx - 4 bits, state component: 0 - normal (values are defined), 1 - cover, 2 - contain, 3 - inherit, 4 - initial, 5 - unset, 6-15 - unused ww - 2 bits, width component: 0 - auto, 1 - length, 2 - percentage, 3 - unused hh - 2 bits, height component: 0 - auto, 1 - length, 2 - percentage, 3 - unused see also: http://stackoverflow.com/a/12691132
member.example: Default value : 0000 00 00 (normal; auto; auto) Cover value : 0001 00 00 Contain value : 0010 00 00 Inherit value : 0011 00 00 Initial value : 0100 00 00 Unset value : 0101 00 00 Len/Len : 0000 01 01 Len/Perc : 0000 01 10 Perc/Len : 0000 10 01 Perc/Perc : 0000 10 10 Auto/Len : 0000 00 01 Perc/Auto : 0000 10 00

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.op_Equality(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize)
member.summary: Checks whether two "BackgroundSize" values are equal

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.op_Inequality(GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize)
member.summary: Checks whether two "BackgroundSize" values are not equal

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.Auto
member.summary: Width and height are both 'auto' - default value

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.Cover
member.summary: Scales the image as large as possible and maintains image aspect ratio (image doesn't get squished).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.Contain
member.summary: Scales the image as large as possible and maintains image aspect ratio (image doesn't get squished).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.DimensionType.Auto
member.summary: A keyword that scales the background image in the corresponding direction such that its intrinsic proportion is maintained. Default value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.DimensionType.LengthDefined
member.summary: Value is defined by specific 'Length' unit

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.DimensionType.PercentageDefined
member.summary: Value is defined by specific 'Percent' unit

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.ValueType
member.summary: Represents a type of the value for 'BackgroundSize' property

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.ValueType.Normal
member.summary: Normal type - one or both dimensions are specified via 'auto', length or percent value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.ValueType.Cover
member.summary: A keyword that is the inverse of 'contain'. Scales the image as large as possible and maintains image aspect ratio (image doesn't get squished).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.SpecificDeclarations.Background.BackgroundSize.ValueType.Contain
member.summary: A keyword that scales the image as large as possible and maintains image aspect ratio (image doesn't get squished).

member.summary: Represents all possible styles values for all types of standard borders in CSS.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.None
member.summary: Displays no border. In case of table cell and border collapsing, the "none" value has the lowest priority. Default value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Hidden
member.summary: Displays no border. In case of table cell and border collapsing, the "hidden" value has the highest priority.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Dotted
member.summary: Displays a series of rounded dots.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Dashed
member.summary: Displays a series of short square-ended dashes or line segments.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Solid
member.summary: Displays a single, straight, solid line.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Double
member.summary: Displays two straight lines that add up to the pixel amount defined as "border-width" or "border-right-width".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Groove
member.summary: Displays a border leading to a carved effect. It is the opposite of "ridge".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Ridge
member.summary: Displays a border with a 3D effect, like if it is coming out of the page. It is the opposite of "groove".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Inset
member.summary: Displays a border that makes the box appear embedded. It is the opposite of "outset".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.StandardPropComponents.BorderStyleValue.Outset
member.summary: Displays a border that makes the box appear in 3D, embossed. It is the opposite of "inset".

member.param: Input string
Start inclusive index

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.TrimStart(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Removes specified prefix from source string, if it starts with this prefix

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.GetInnerStringBetweenTokens(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.Direction,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Finds and returns a substring from input string, which is located between specified start and end tokens. Performs a searching of the start and end tokens from specified start index and to the specified end index, and returns first suitable substring. Returns NULL, if tokens were not found in specified interval.
member.param: Input string, where search operation is performed. Cannot be NULL or empty.
Start token. Cannot be NULL or empty.
End token. Cannot be NULL or empty.
Start inclusive index, from which the search begins. If is 0 - search begins from the start of the string. If lesser than 0 or exceeds the length of the string, the exception will be thrown.

End inclusive index, on which searching stops and doesn't go beyond it. If exceeds the length of the input string, or is a zero, or lesser than zero, searching will reach the end of the string. If is greater than zero, but simultaneously lesser or equal to the start index, then exception will be thrown.
Defines is it necessary to include the start and end tokens into the resultant substring

Defines the direction of the searching of the end token, when a start token is found. FromStartToEnd - searching proceeds from the next character beyond the start token, which was found, and continues till the end index or the end of the string. FromEndToStart - searching begins from the end index (or from the end of the input string) and proceeds in the backward direction until it reaches the start token.
Defines how strings are compared each other
member.returns: Resultant substring or NULL, if at least one token was not found.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.GetSubstringToToken(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.Direction,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Returns a substring from the input string, which is located before the first specified token, starting from start or from the end of input string
member.param: Input string
Token, which determines the end of the returning substring
true - token will be present in the substring; false - will be not present

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Tools.StringTools.GetSubstringToToken(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Returns a substring from the input string, which is located before the first specified token. Additional parameters allow to specify the search position, string comparison options etc.
member.param: Input string. Cannot be NULL, empty or whitespace
Token, which determines the end of the returning substring. Cannot be NULL or empty.
true - token will be present in the resultant substring; false - will be not present
Determines what to do if the token is not found: return a substring till the end of the input string (true) or return a null substring (false)
Allows to specify a position in the input string, from which the search and resultant substring (if found) will begin. Cannot be lesser then 0 or bigger then input string length.

member.summary: List of all children. Content of the list can be mutated (children can be added or removed), but the list itself is readonly. member.remarks: This option forcibly applies the specified locale to overall text in the document. Do not use it, if document contains different parts of text, which are written on different languages.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.HtmlToWords.WordsSaveOptions.LocaleBi

member.remarks: This option forcibly applies the specified locale to overall RTL text in the document. Do not use it, if document contains different parts of text, which are written on different languages.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.HtmlToWords.WordsSaveOptions.LocaleFarEast
member.summary: Allows to override the locale (language) for the Word document for the East-Asian text, which will be applied during its creation. member.remarks: This option forcibly applies the specified locale to overall East-Asian text in the document. Do not use it, if document contains different parts of text, which are written on different languages.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.BookmarkProcessor
member.summary: Processes the bookmarks, which serves as anchors in the Words documents
member.remarks: Bookmarks serves as anchors in the Words format. There are several difficulties with them: 1. In the DOM they are sequential, not hierarchical. 2. They are not limited - bookmark may start on one paragraph, continue on next and finish in third. Different Runs can 'stuck' in different 'gaps' between paragraph start/end and bookmark start/end. 3. They can be nested into each other, and nesting level is unlimited. 4. Their start/end marks can be shuffled in arbitrary order, like the next: b1_start , b2_start, b1_end, b3_start, b2_end, b3_end 5. There is a '_GoBack' useless bookmark, which should be ignored during processing.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.BookmarkProcessor.ProcessBookmark(Aspose.Words.BookmarkStart,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Html.NormalElementBase,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssDeclarationBlock,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssOm)
member.summary: Processes one bookmark and returns a node, which follows after the bookmark end mark or NULL, if there are no siblings
member.param: Start mark of the bookmark. Should not be NULL.
HTML element in the output document, to which will be added all processed content. Should not be NULL.
Declaration block of the parent HTML element, which content may be used for eliminating redundancies in the code. May be (and in most cases should be) NULL. Used only for processing the runs.
Output stylesheet, to which will be added all CSS rules. Should not be NULL.
member.returns: If bookmark occupies more than one paragraph (for example, starts in one paragraph, and ends in second), this method will return NULL, but not the next sibling after end mark of the bookmark.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.BookmarkProcessor.ForwardIfGoBack(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Analyzes specified node of unknown kind and if it is a common empty '_GoBack' useless bookmark, then returns the next adjacent sibling after this '_GoBack'. Otherwise returns NULL.

member.returns: If true, then at least one border side is visible, was processed and CSS declaration(s) were added to the output declaration block. If false, there is no visible borders at all, and output declaration block was untouched.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.FontProcessor.ProcessOneFont(Aspose.Words.Font,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssDeclarationBlock)
member.summary: Processes specified font and fills specified output CssDeclarationBlock with extracted data.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.FontProcessor.ProcessOneFont(Aspose.Words.Font,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssDeclarationBlock,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssDeclarationBlock,GroupDocs.Editor.HtmlCss.Css.CssDeclarationBlock)
member.summary: Processes specified font and fills specified output CssDeclarationBlock with extracted data. Allows to specify parent item, which values should be overridden, if present.
member.param: Input font, which should be analyzed and grabbed as a set of CSS declarations. Cannot be NULL.

CSS declaration block of the parent item, which can contain CSS declarations, applicable to the current block. Can be NULL - in this case it will be ignored, and all grabbed data will be written to the argument.

Output declaration block, to which the effective declarations will be added. Cannot be NULL. Effective declarations are declarations, which are not present or are different from those in the specified argument. If is not set (NULL or empty), then all grabbed declarations are treated as effective and will be added to this output declaration block.

Output declaration block, to which all existent declarations will be added, regardless to the argument, even if it is specified. Can be NULL - in such case this method will fill only argument with "effective" declarations. Existent declarations are declarations, which are part of the run styling and can be grabbed by this method.

members.member:

Frame is a legacy control from pre-DOCX era, but is is still supportable in DOCX and the latest versions of MS Word. http://www.addbalance.com/word/frames_textboxes.htm

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.ListProcessor
member.summary: Processes all types of lists: numbered, with standard and Wingdings unordered marks, with custom string marks, and with image marks
member.remarks:
Very complicated due to list complication in Words format, Aspose.Words DOM API and lack of feature set in HTML/CSS. List of used resources: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7698764/custom-bullet-symbol-for-li-elements-in-ul-that-is-a-regular-character-and http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3203252/unicode-character-as-bullet-for-list-item-in-css http://www.alanwood.net/demos/wingdings.html https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wingdings https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dingbat https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-image https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type
Set of the list-related Aspose.Words forum posts: https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/820058/aspose.words-questions-about-lists.aspx https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/819420/aspose.words-questions-about-image-bulleted-lists-with-custom-images.aspx https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/835655/aspose.words-obtain-the-correct-distance-between-list-label-and-content-of-list-item.aspx https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/836181/aspose.words-17.4-incorrect-number-of-the-list-nesting-level.aspx
The _string_ value (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type#Values) of the 'list-style-type' property cannot be used instead of '::before' pseudo-class hack due to the next reasons: 1. it is curently supported only in Gecko/Firefox (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type#Browser_compatibility); 2. it cannot be tuned (padding, margin, distance between mark and main text in list item etc); 3. it cannot work with Wingdings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.ListProcessor._maxListNestingLevelInclusive
member.summary: MS Word supports 9 levels of nesting in lists, which are 0-based: first level is 0 and last is 8

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.ShapeProcessor
member.summary: Processes all kinds of shapes, which are supported by Aspose.Words and implement 'ShapeBase' abstract class. Works as a batch processor, i.e. processes multiple shapes during one call, if these shapes are adjacent nodes and have the same properties.
member.remarks:
This work is far away from the ending. Shapes are much more complex than they appear, and the ideal solution for them is impossible due to the different nature of the Word and HTML/CSS formats, and also to the lack of some features in the HTML/CSS.
Key things, which were taken into account in this processor, in a form of the very short excerpt:
1. Need to stay away from "Aspose.Words.Rendering.ShapeRenderer" in all cases, where it is possible. "ShapeRenderer" reconverts images even if input and output formats are the same, and resultant image quality is very bad. Reconverting process has also quite significant performance penalty. This code uses "ShapeRenderer" only for the GroupShape instances and for all other images, which are not possible to transfer to the HTML/CSS directly.
2. GroupShape instances are processed on the most primitive level - they are simply "opened" as a "document inside the document", and their content is passed to the high-level DOM iterator. Maybe this is not the better solution; the older one used ShapeRenderer for GroupShapes.
3. If multiple shapes appear in one paragraph one after another (they are adjacent siblings), and all of them are 'text wrap-enabled', then they are most likely mutually positioned. Their coordinate system is absolute (and is converted to the relative for resultant CSS) and they may be "floatable" (text may float around them or between them, and they also float one around other). Positioning support is very crude and primitive, but much more advanced, than the standard Aspose.Words HTML converter delivers.
4. If two or more shapes are mutually positioned and are adjacent siblings (it is described in previous item), their order in the DOM tree may not be valid - first image can precede the second and so on. Need to re-sort them based on their coordinates.
5. There is a special kind of shapes, which in this code is named as "rasterized text". Actually, this is a complex text with non-standard positioning, which is wrapped inside "Shape" class. It is possible to treat this as raster image using "ShapeRenderer" (this does standard Aspose.Words HTML converter), but this code treats them as standard textual content. The basic evidences of "rasterized text" are: they have no image content (ImageBytes property is empty) and they have child nodes (one child "Paragraph" in most cases). As for standard images, the "rasterized text" shapes can be mutually positioned, if are present as adjacent siblings within one super-node.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Editor.Words.WordsToHtml.Processors.TableProcessor
member.summary: Responsible for processing the tables
member.remarks:
Main issue of such non-obvious and entangled code is that Aspose.Words public API can represent horizontally-merged cells using two approaches: 1) horizontally merged cells are represented with multiple cells, where first has a CellMerge.First flag and all content, and sub-sequential has a CellMerge.Previous flag, zero width and has no content. 2) horizontally merged cells are represented with one single cell, which has respective width (that allows to cover necessary space) and there are no flags or other things that allow to detect its status. More info here: https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/790555/aspose.words-16.8.0-cannot-detect-horizontally-merged-cells-and-other-questions.aspx Second approach is the most widely used, and in order to find out merged cells, width comparison and coordinate ranging is used.
Second problem is with borders: adjacent cells in fact has one border, but border-related data in these cells may differ. General rule, which should be applied, is "last cell wins". It means, that if we have two consecutive cells in one row ("Prev" and "Next") with border between them, and if "Prev" cell has a visible right border, while "Next" cell has invisible left border, this means that final border between these cells should be invisible. Reaching this rule requires additional actions, and for the sake of simplicity I has chosen the 'hidden' value for the 'border-style' property, as it has the highest priority in the browser.
Third problem is that the row height is controlled by the "HeightRule" enumeration, which has 3 values: "Auto", "Exactly", and "AtLeast". While first two have no problems, the 3rd is quite problematic: there is no 100% correct HTML/CSS equivalent, and browsers treat the "height" CSS property as an exact height. "min-height" property has no affect on tables at all due to the CSS 2.1 specification. There are several roundabound ways, I chose the intermediate DIV wrapper around the content of the first cell in the row with "min-height" property. Sources: Problem: https://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/834052/aspose.words-17.3-incorrect-table-row-height-in-dom-api-and-resultant-html.aspx http://auckland.dynabic.com/jira/browse/WORDSNET-15156 Solution: http://stackoverflow.com/a/8822166 http://stackoverflow.com/a/11810223 http://stackoverflow.com/a/19432261
